website_summaries.verdict: A set of classic champagne classes perfect for gifting to a newly wed couple or yourself.
pros: Fairly priced and quality-made, these full-lead crystal champagne glasses are backed by a lifetime replacement policy
They feature a great shape for sustaining bubbles and offer the perfect combination of delicateness and sturdiness
cons: Clinking sound isn't great, which is disappointing when it's time for a toast

customer_reviews.title: the form - is very nice. But
customer_reviews.text: Very strange product. The quality of glass, the shape, the form - is very nice. But... it's curved! Basically 50% comes as deffective. They don't stay still and if you rotate it around it stem you clearly see how decentralized it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would've made for a decent set, but...
customer_reviews.text: The bottoms are so uneven that 4 out of 6 flutes would have to be discarded. They just aren't stable enough. Will return. It puzzles me how this product got such stellar reviews.
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: Very good ones!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a present and I am more than satisfied! The quality is very good! Comes in very good packaging! All glasses came not broken
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: a bit too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I think this glass is a bit too tall. I say this because it makes the glass heavy. Additionally it will be more difficult to put on the shelf as you might have to raise the shelf. My shorter glasses are better. The price is good and we purchased two packs for a party so it's great for that purpose but I would not use as part of my daly glassware. Bottom line I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Love these flutes!
customer_reviews.text: I registered for a different brand of champagne flutes for my wedding, but when they arrived, they were awkwardly tall and too thin. I exchanged them for these flutes which I have been very pleased with. They are thin enough to still be elegant and sheer, but not too thin to worry you will break them. We've enjoyed them for everyday use, as well as special toasting occasions. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice champagne glasses
customer_reviews.text: These Lenox champagne glasses are exactly what I was looking to buy. They are perfect for a nice champagne dinner with my wife and another couple. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality champagne flutes. Was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased with the packaging and delivery
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas present and was much appreciated. I was pleased with the packaging and delivery. I would have liked to keep them for my self !
customer_reviews.author: Sharon G. Hook

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shape, horrible sound
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous champagne flutes... I bought 8 of them and they look lovely. But don't try "clinking" them or you'll puke! Couldn't believe how awful it sounded. That's my only caveat.
customer_reviews.author: F. Beu

customer_reviews.title: There’s a scratch on a brand new glass
customer_reviews.text: I’m really unhappy while unboxing. One out of four of the glasses has a scratch that’s over a inch long.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Washer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I suggest not to get anything from them. There was one glass missing in the box. And the Champaign glasses were not brand new they were used.
customer_reviews.author: Dea

customer_reviews.title: Excellent merchant
customer_reviews.text: Good quality of product, as advertised. Excellent packaging, timely delivery. .
customer_reviews.author: Susana Conde

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, fragile and no crystal ring
customer_reviews.text: Very elegant, very fragile and when full, sounds like plastic when toasted. When empty, a nice ring but empty glasses are not often toasted. So, overall pretty but not great. Who doesn't toast champagne? IMHO, a nice ring is important.
customer_reviews.author: zigzagg

customer_reviews.title: Great toasting flutes!
customer_reviews.text: Each year on Christmas Eve our family enjoys a champagne toast. I purchased five sets of these champagne flutes. All came in perfect condition. They were packed very well. So happy I purchased them and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: justme

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: No ring when tapped. Relatively thick glass. Disappointing as I still have a couple of thin Libbey crystal glasses that do have a ring when tapped from a gift years back. No bead on rim which is what I was after (and is like those good old Libbeys). Just cheap glassware. If you want quality, pay for it and buy Riedel as evidently Libbey no longer makes any.
customer_reviews.author: I am not Rappaport

customer_reviews.title: As a person who appreciates a nice Champagne glass...
customer_reviews.text: I actually prefer Prosecco, and this is the right glass for the occasion at all times. I enjoy it, especially when winding down after a hard day, or just to enjoy the enjoyable moment. The arrived unbroken, flawless and with all its beauty. The only thing I don't like about this type of glass is that it's not as easy to clean and make spotless, but that is an issue with pretty much any Champagne glass, is it not? Buy it, and enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Window_Seat

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses are a great quality. They were inexpensive but not cheaply made. They’ve been used often, hand washed and look good as new. The price was so good I may buy another box.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Glasses are great. I have two sets
customer_reviews.text: Glasses are great. I have two sets. The quality is there and they are heavier than you would expect. But heavy in a good durable way. I don't worry about them breaking when I wash them or store them. I sometimes put them in the dish washer(though rarely) and the stems are still intact.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M

customer_reviews.title: Lenox flutes
customer_reviews.text: Very easily broken. Replaced daughter in laws flutes since my husband broke one when visiting. I wish you could buy just one but you couldn't so we bought the set. Now he can break some more and we are covered. Nice glasses though!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: perfect flutes
customer_reviews.text: I love these champagne flutes. They are very nice and good quality. I know I will get many uses out of these. I'm happy i bought them and trust the Lenox name.
customer_reviews.author: my name is just Beth

customer_reviews.title: They are beautiful
customer_reviews.text: These were for a housewarming gift and the couple were very impressed and were afraid to use them at first, because they didn’t want to break them! They are beautiful
customer_reviews.author: Sheri D.

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: Love these flutes!! Sturdy, while still thin and classy looking. I’m sure these will last a long while. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Here is the perfect flute
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much I bought four sets. I think I may need more... The shape is perfect: The stem is long and graceful, the depth of the flute is ideal for sustaining bubbles, it has the appropriate capacity of about 6 oz, and simple lines showcase your beautiful champagne. They feel very substantial--the picture is deceiving. While they are delicate crystal, they are not thin or light. Obviously they need to be washed carefully, but what stemware doesn't? Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Great glasses! Made a pair of wedding glasses from them.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Baker

product_meta.description:
Size:2.30 LBAt Lenox, we strive to make the daily moments in your life a bit more special. Inspired by heritage and designed for now, we bring a rich history of craftsmanship to modern day life. We’ve been a part of homes for over 130 years. Each time you buy Lenox, you are buying a versatile and timeless piece crafted with our century-long commitment to quality, artistry and beauty. Whether you’re gathering the family for dinner, grabbing a midnight snack for yourself in front of the TV or having friends over, Lenox is for real moments that last on products that are meant for living. Crafted of durable and elegant non-lead European crystal, the Tuscany Classics 4-piece Champagne Toasting Flute Set is ideal for toasting to a special occassion, or simply enjoying a refreshing champagne or prosecco. This set is break-resistant and dishwasher-safe, for added convenience.

AMAZON.COM
Invoking the spirit of Italian vineyards, Lenox has created the Tuscany Classics line of stem- and barware with elegant proportions and beautifully balanced shapes. Subtly tapered and comfortable to hold, these classic champagne flutes are crafted from full-lead crystal and sound a lovely ringing note during a toast. Lenox's structure features a substantial seam between bowl and stem, so you can hold the glass stably without warming the contents. The foursome comes with a lifetime replacement policy. Washing by hand is recommended. --Emily Bedard
